enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Pre-requisite: Students must have completed Psych 205 in order to register for this course.
title: WCAS PSYCH 387-0-20 Consumer Psychology and Marketing Research
class_attributes:
Social & Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

Attendance at 1st class mandatory

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is an introduction to the application of psychological science to our ability to understand, predict, and influence consumer behavior. In addition to covering core theories and empirical findings relevant to the science of consumer psychology, this course involves the hands-on application of research methods to address real-world marketing questions and problems. Students will be involved in the design and execution of an applied marketing research project. Students will analyze data from the project and learn how to effectively communicate the results to a non-scientific, business audience.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Knowledge of core theories and findings in consumer psychology.
Familiarity with research design, data analysis and results presentation for marketing problems.
